answerText: Sedimentary Rock[10] This term refers to the igneous and metamorphic rocks that underlie sedimentary rock in any given area. The rocks that constitute it are very often of Precambrian age.
heading: MUT |2015 | 3 | 7 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Remnants of existing rocks called clasts form this type of rock when buried, compacted, and cemented. [10] Name these rocks formed by lithification after the deposition of material on the Earth's surface.
